result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Romell Jackson was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Richard Henry Hart in court, defendant Romell Jackson not in court, in custody by video-conference.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Case in court for continued state's motion hearing. Court reviews doctor reports with the parties; no challenges to the reports by the State or defense counsel.  Court finds that defendant is a candidate for conditional release. Court adopts/approves May 24, 2017 Conditional Release Plan. The defendant was committed to the Dept. of Health Services on December 15, 2015. Court ordered a period of 96 months committment.  Court orders DHS and the 51.42 board of Milwaukee County prepare a plan that identifies the treatment and services and who will be responsible for providing the treatment and services identified in the plan. For further reasons stated on the record, defendant to have no contact within 1000 feet of following persons residences: Sean K., Deputy James Jarvis, Deputy Mary Sawczuk, Dawn R., Frankie G. or Jennifer D. The plan to be presented to the court within 60 days.  Order for Conditional Release Plan signed by the Court and filed.  Court schedules no future court date.
-From WCS Forensic Services Unit; Received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Romell Jackson in court with Attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Romell Jackson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing commences.
Exhibit #1 marked for identification.
Sworn and testified:  Dr. Robert Rawski.
Exhibit # 1 offered and received.  State and defense rest.  Arguments to the court.
Court concluded that the defendant was suffering from a mental defect which prevented the defendant from conforming his behavior to the requirements of the law pursuant to Wisconsin Statute 971.17(2).

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST as to all counts.
Court finds that defendant is not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.

Judge found that the defendant is not capable of being released to the community and ordered defendant commited to Winnebago/Mendota State Hospital pursuant to Wisconsin statute 971.17(3)(a).
Court ordered defendant confined for institutional care for  15 years and  6  months concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 211 days. 

Order of Commitment signed by the Court and filed.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Richard Hart appeared requesting a new date for the Phase 2 portion of this matter, which is currently set for December 4, 2015.  Telephone call made to coordinate date with Dr. Rawski.   Matter calendared for Phase 2 on December 17, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  ADA Carmody notified via email and requested to subpoena Dr. Rawski.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be reassigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders in room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Romell Jackson in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Romell Jackson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information previously received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty, and requested a special plea be entered: Not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. 

CR-270 signed and filed. 

 Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Romell Jackson in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Romell Jackson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT, ADDING COUNT 3:BATTERY TO A LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.20(2), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  COUNT 4:BATTERY TO EMERGENCY RESCUE WORKER,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.20(7)(b), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  COUNT 5:BATTERY TO EMERGENCY RESCUE WORKER,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.20(7)(b), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  COUNT 6:HIT AND RUN-INJURY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.67(1), 346.74(5)(b) and 346.74(5)(e) a Felony.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
TOT Justice Point

Court sets bail in the amount of $5,000.00 cash TOT to Justice Point with the following conditions:  Drug testing, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance, no firearms/dangerous weapons, mental health/medications monitoring, no contact with Froedter Hospital unless transported via ambulance and needs Level 1 Trauma.  Said bail subject to review upon Praxis review and work up.

Defendant Romell Jackson in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Romell Jackson in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not contest the findings of report.  Court reinstates proceedings.  Matter scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing in Prelim. Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.

Defendant Romell Jackson in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Romell Jackson in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
